alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 9:54PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST/6 PM MDT/ MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding on Chinle Wash caused by snowmelt in the Chuska Mountains will continue through Monday. This is mainly due to flow over spillways of Tsaile Dam and Wheatfields Dam, bringing water down Canyon del Muerto and Coyote Wash. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including the following county, Apache. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MST Monday /600 PM MDT Monday/. * IMPACTS...Flooding in and adjacent to Chinle Wash and upstream washes, creeks and streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 951 PM MST /1051 PM MDT/, Minor flooding is still occurring in and near Chinle Wash. - Chinle Wash is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chinle, Canyon De Chelly National Monument and portions of the Navajo Nation just downstream of Chinle. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Keep children away from culverts, creeks and washes! Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event.
